532 Gallery Jaeckel
CECILIA DANELL:
Wood Anemone, 2024
Oil and acrylic on canvas
30 × 40 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$1900
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

Inspired by spring walks in Swedish and Irish natures, this painting uses spray paint and oils to capture the vivid whites and greens of anemones, detaching from source photos to form an immersive forest narrative that treats landscape as an extension of the self. Framed dimensions: 32.5 × 42.5 × 4 cm.

About the artist:

Cecilia Danell’s multidisciplinary practice merges painting, sculpture, film, and textiles, focusing on landscape psychology and materiality as extensions of the self. Her process-driven works detach from photographic sources to forge new narratives, capturing vibrant forest scenes and cropped details with spray paint and oils for immersive, sensory experiences.

Cecilia Danell was born in 1985 in Sweden and is based in Ireland. She holds degrees in fine art, with residencies at Monson Arts, USA (2024) and Ballinglen Arts Foundation, Ireland (2021).

Danell has had solo exhibitions including “Brush Lightly Through Fireweed Forests” at Kevin Kavanagh, Dublin (2022) and “A Stillness Expanded” at Claremorris Gallery, Ireland (2023). She has participated in recent group exhibitions at the 195th RHA Annual Exhibition, Dublin (2025); Salong Östergötland, Linköping Konsthall, Sweden (2025); and “What the Plants Know” at Galway International Arts Festival (2024).
